p: Laboratory bioassay data revealed that the essential oil of C. dioscoridis exhibited strongest repellency toward ticks compared to all other essential oils. Therefore, the essential oil of C. dioscoridis was applied in the field trail at a concentration of 6.5 µg/cm 2. This oil elicited a significant repellent activity against I. ricinus nymphs on two consecutive days ( P < 0.05, Fig. 1).
